name: Snapshots API
title: Snapshots API
description: Using the USA TODAY Snapshots API, developers will be able to construct their own custom feeds for USA TODAY Snapshots. Snapshots are easy-to-read statistical graphics that present information on various issues and trends in a visually appealing way, posted online every day Monday through Friday.

days.description: Use this parameter to define the date that a snapshot was created, in terms of elapsed days. If you wish to define the published date instead of the creation date, append '&date=publishedDate' to your query.

id.description: Use this parameter to return a specific snapshot, setting the id variable to a specific snapshot's unique identification number

keywords.description: Use this parameter to to search snapshots based on tag. Note that spaces should be input as '+', and multiple keywords should be separated by commas.

last.description: By default, the Snapshots API will return the single latest snapshot. Setting last to any number will return that many of the latest snapshots.

section.description: Set section to any one of our fronts (life, news, sports, etc.) to pull snapshots exclusively from that section.

start.description: Define the starting date for a snapshot call.

end.description: Define the ending date for a snapshot call
